title: Christianity and Colonialism: Critical Reading and Complex Thinking Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of religious studies and colonial history, with analytical skills for social issues
context.additional_context: Interactive learning environment using digital devices, providing continuous feedback through formative assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can critically analyze literature addressing the interaction between Christianity and colonialism and derive core arguments
Learners improve multidimensional thinking skills by exploring historical cases in simulation/VR environments
Learners can construct logical frameworks integrating complex social issues within religious and historical contexts

resources: Scholarly Resources on Religious Studies and Colonialism

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
